# example.conf: A single-node Flume configurationF
# <1>flume-ng agent --name a1 \
# --conf /home/cloudera/flume/conf \
# --conf-file /home/cloudera/flume/conf/flume-example.conf
#
# <2>telnet localhost 44444
# <3>type any characters rom telnet sesssion

# Name the components on this agent
a1.sources = r1
a1.sinks = k1
a1.channels = c1

# soure is generated by command "telnet localhost 44444"
# Describe/configure the source
a1.sources.r1.type = netcat
a1.sources.r1.bind = localhost
a1.sources.r1.port = 44444

# Describe the sink
a1.sinks.k1.type = hdfs

# Use a channel which buffers events in memory
a1.channels.c1.type = memory
a1.channels.c1.capacity = 1000
a1.channels.c1.transactionCapacity = 100
#Each transaction can have 100 events and a channel can hold up to 1000 event before it is flushed to the sink


## Customizing sink for hdfs
a1.sinks.k1.hdfs.path = hdfs://quickstart.cloudera:8020/user/cloudera/flume
a1.sinks.k1.hdfs.filePrefix = netcat
a1.sinks.k1.hdfs.fileType = DataStream
a1.sinks.k1.hdfs.rollInterval = 120

# Bind the source and sink to the channel
a1.sources.r1.channels = c1
a1.sinks.k1.channel = c1
